title.description: Title of the project. E.g. the research project title, or GitHub project name.

body_text.description: The original text of the document

innovation_ranking.description: A score representing how 'innovative' the project is, between 0 (least innovative) and 1 (most innovative). This attribute is liable to change as more sophisticated project innovation metrics are developed.

pub_med_uids.description: Unique IDs associated with articles on PubMed.

source.description: The original data source for this project, e.g. 'WorldReport', 'GitHub'

funding_amount.description: The amount awarded to the project (in USD?)

institutions.description: All of the institutions mentioned in the body text of the project.

funder.description: The main funding body for the project as identified in the original data.

mesh_labels.description: The MeSH labels that have been associated with the body text of the project.

count.description: Number of times that the term has occured in the corpus of project descriptions.

term_0.description: The first term of the cooccurring pair when sorted alphabetically.

term_1.description: The second term of the coocurring pair when sorted alphabetically.

association_strength.description: A probabalistic weighting of the term-term coocurrence. See Noyons et al. 2010.

project_0.description: The first project of the cooccurring pair when sorted by Project ID.

project_1.description: The second project of the cooccurring pair when sorted by Project ID.

jaccard_similarity.description: A measure of similarity between two projects based on the overlap of the MeSH terms that they have been labelled with.

name.description: Name of the country in English.

country.description: The country in which the funding body is based.
